intro: Alyssum betpakdalense, commonly known as the Betpakdala alyssum, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, which bloom in late summer. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that are adapted to conserve water. Alyssum betpakdalense is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is well-suited to harsh, dry environments.
